nodes.label: Algorithm
nodes.details: A finite sequence of well-defined instructions, typically used to solve a class of specific problems or to perform a computation.

nodes.label: Data Structure
nodes.details: A particular way of organizing and storing data in a computer so that it can be accessed and modified efficiently.

nodes.label: Array
nodes.details: A data structure consisting of a collection of elements, each identified by at least one array index or key.

nodes.label: Sorting Algorithm
nodes.details: An algorithm that puts elements of a list into a certain order (e.g., numerical or lexicographical).

nodes.label: Stack
nodes.details: A linear data structure which follows the LIFO (Last In First Out) principle.

nodes.label: Recursion
nodes.details: A method of solving a problem where the solution depends on solutions to smaller instances of the same problem.
